item.title: How capital gains tax changes could impact you
item.description: According to a well-sourced leak, changes to capital gains tax discounts could form the centrepiece of the next federal budget in May. And while the government has downplayed the idea, it has not been ruled out.

item.title: Union urges Sanjeev Gupta to sell Tahmoor mine as $350m offer revealed
item.description: The Mining and Energy Union says a firm $350 million offer is on the table to restart Tahmoor Colliery, warning delays risk the mine's future and hundreds of jobs.

item.title: Man convicted of grooming one girl and raping another at Canberra Reptile Zoo
item.description: A 26-year-old man has been convicted in the ACT Supreme Court of sexually assaulting two girls at Canberra Reptile Zoo.

item.title: Thursday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Nationals issue Ley with reunion counteroffer as deadline looms
item.description: The minor party has given the opposition leader terms that one Nationals MP said they did "not expect" would be acceptable in what has been described as a bid to push out her self-imposed deadline.

item.title: Victoria and Queensland lose 17 wickets on day one of MCG Sheffield Shield game
item.description: After the two-day Ashes Test raised eyebrows over the MCG pitch, Queensland and Victoria are on track for another swift finish after 17 wickets on day one of their Sheffield Shield clash.

item.title: Keir Starmer apologises to Epstein's victims for appointing Lord Mandelson as ambassador to US
item.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer says former ambassador to the US Peter Mandelson lied when asked about the nature of his relationship with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: New study reveals how stressful footy fandom can be
item.description: A new study reveals how much high-stakes sporting events can get the heart pumping by strapping trackers to over 200 German football fans.

item.title: Epstein files reveal the men who looked away after women had spoken up
item.description: The millions of pages of documents related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have shone a light on how many influential men were ready to disregard the experiences of countless women.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese signs security treaty with Indonesia
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has travelled to Jakarta to sign the treaty, which the Australian government calls the "biggest step" the countries have taken together in 30 years.

item.title: Former attorney-general Mark Dreyfus warned anti-corruption chief to 'manage' or 'avoid' conflicts
item.description: A letter from Mark Dreyfus to Paul Brereton provides new insight into the expectations set for the inaugural chief of the anti-corruption watchdog.

item.title: Effect of capital gains tax changes on housing affordability likely depends on design
item.description: Labor has not ruled out changes to the capital gains tax discount but wants any tax changes to improve housing affordability.

item.title: Jim Chalmers's appetite for economic reform is about to be tested
item.description: Jim Chalmers could face his biggest test yet as treasurer over the next few months.

item.title: The questions dogging the search for Gus Lamont after latest police update
item.description: Police declared the disappearance of Gus Lamont a major crime due to "a number of inconsistencies and discrepancies" emerging during the four-month investigation.

item.title: US hopes to challenge China's critical minerals dominance with new trading bloc
item.description: The US is urging dozens of countries to follow Australia's lead and sign on to a plan to stop relying on China for the critical minerals used in modern technology.

item.title: What Israel's President Isaac Herzog has said about Gaza, and why he won't be arrested in Australia
item.description: When Israel's president lands in Australia this weekend, he can expect an official red carpet treatment. But he will be all too aware of the controversy his visit is generating.

item.title: ATO debt continues to drive record level of calls to small business financial helpline
item.description: Financial counsellors say small businesses struggling to pay debts owed to the tax office are driving calls to Australia's Small Business Debt Helpline higher.

item.title: Karnivool's new album In Verses was worth the 13-year wait, bagpipes and all
item.description: They're one of Australia's most revered heavy acts. And arguably the most patient. Karnivool unpack the 13-year journey to their new album, In Verses.

item.title: ASX suffers worst day in almost a year in 'panic' sell-off — as it happened
item.description: Nearly $70 billion has been wiped off the Australian share market in its worst trading session since the "Liberation Day" sell-off in April 2025. See how the day unfolded and read insights from our business reporters on the ABC News markets blog.

item.title: Georgia Voll helps Royal Challengers Bengaluru win Indian Women's Premier League
item.description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru pulled off the biggest successful chase in the Women's Premier League to win their second title in the Indian franchise-based T20 league.

item.title: Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis defends controversial Perth and WA demersal fishing ban
item.description: A "judgement call" about a permanent commercial fishing ban for demersal species went further than the advice handed to her, WA's Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis says.

item.title: WA Premier Roger Cook writes letter to 13yo hero swimmer Austin Appelbee
item.description: Premier Roger Cook writes to the 13-year-old, who made international headlines after swimming 4 kilometres in rough seas to raise the alarm and save his family.

item.title: Demersal fishing reforms drive fish and chip price rise on WA's south coast
item.description: The two-time winner of Australia's Best Takeaway Fish and Chips says it has been forced to increase prices considerably following Western Australia's demersal fishing reforms.

item.title: Questions raised over $93 million investment in WA school with 30 per cent attendance rate
item.description: By the end of 2026 the WA government and Woodside will have spent over $93 million on Roebourne District High School and its 141 enrolled students. But last year only one in four upper school students attended.

item.title: Man shot dead by police after suspected domestic-related stabbing on NSW Mid North Coast
item.description: Police say a man shot dead by an officer was armed with a knife and chainsaw when he stabbed a woman during an earlier assault in Tuncurry.

item.title: NSW Liberal leader Kellie Sloane talks Chris Minns, polls, slogan bans and Bondi
item.description: The leader of the NSW opposition says the trait behind Premier Chris Minns's popularity is also his greatest weakness, declaring the Coalition is "absolutely in the game" to win next year's state election.

item.title: French authorities sink tonnes of cocaine bound for Australia, then release suspects
item.description: French authorities intercept a ship carrying five tonnes of cocaine bound for Australia, before releasing the vessel and its crew.

item.title: No sign of Dezi Freeman as latest search ends in Mount Buffalo National Park
item.description: Detectives say they will not give up on finding Victorian fugitive Dezi Freeman, accused of killing two police officers and injuring a third.

item.description: A cross-border search has begun for a man after an unoccupied boat was found about 50 kilometres off the Gold Coast early on Friday morning.

item.title: Terrorist act declaration for Invasion Day attempted bombing shows WA has changed
item.description: It will take time and significant effort to repair relationships with the Indigenous community amid the fallout from last week's attempted bombing in the Perth CBD — but other growing rifts in society will be even harder to mend.

item.description: Sport was both healing and isolating in the aftermath of a violent sexual assault for Irishwoman Bláthnaid Raleigh.

item.description: The grandparents of missing four-year-old boy Gus Lamont say the family has "cooperated fully with the investigation and want nothing more than to find Gus and reunite him with his mum and dad".

item.title: Australia's surging expectations at the Winter Olympics come thanks to Geoff Henke's strident advocacy
item.description: Australia is hoping Milano Cortina 2026 will be its most successful Winter Olympics in history. The reason for Australia's winter sports surge has its roots in a 70-year-old snubbing.

item.description: When was the last time you cleaned your microwave? According to experts, it's actually a lot simpler than cleaning other appliances.

item.description: WA children's author Craig Silvey gets his bail conditions altered by a Perth court after complaining of "significant media attention" since being charged with child exploitation offences.

item.title: Police to resume searching for Celine Cremer items at Waratah after bones discovery
item.description: Tasmania Police will again head into thick bushland to continue searching for more items in the area where Belgian tourist Celine Cremer vanished in 2023 — after the shock discovery of bones last week.

item.description: As Donald Trump arrived at a golf course in September 2024, a would-be assassin had already been lying in wait for almost 12 hours.

item.description: Experts say our pets have become such an important part of our lives that it's important to take a step back from responsibilities, if possible, when they are sick or dying.

item.description: Police allege a 25-year-old man intercepted at Brisbane International Airport had violent extremist material on his phone, after an investigation into an alleged Nazi flag delivery to the man.

item.title: Bullock says government spending not sole factor pushing inflation higher as political fight heats up
item.description: RBA governor Michele Bullock has refused to blame the Albanese government for rising inflation, as a political fight breaks out in the wake of the bank's rate hike.

item.title: Josh Hazlewood out of T20 World Cup with injury in another blow to Australia's hopes
item.description: Josh Hazlewood is ruled out of Australia's T20 World Cup campaign as he continues to recover from the injuries which kept him from playing in the summer's Ashes series.

item.description: A "continuous" influx of illegal foreign fishing boats in Queensland waters coincides with at least two of the nation's fleet of patrol boats being out of commission.

item.description: When a homemade fragment bomb was allegedly thrown into a crowd on January 26, it took nine days for it to be declared an act of terrorism. The WA police commissioner explains why, as Indigenous leaders raise concerns.

item.title: TC Mitchell set to become severe category 3 system off WA's Pilbara coast
item.description: Residents along WA's Pilbara coast have been warned to prepare to shelter as Cyclone Mitchell builds into a severe category 3 system.

item.description: The claim comes as the US calls for China to be involved in a new deal limiting the use of nuclear weapons, after the New START deal expired this week.

item.title: Albanese's invitation to Herzog is a shift in his approach to Israel
item.description: Unravelling the threads of antisemitism and anti-Israeli sentiment will require both more political courage and more community tolerance than we have seen to date.

item.description: For Noongar Elders, the alleged attack on Boorloo/Perth is viewed against the background of a long history of violence. They are calling for a truth-telling commission to heal deep scars and help to combat racism.

item.description: As another T20 World Cup sneaks up on us, here's everything you need to know about the tournament, including a guide on how to pick which team to support, depending on your needs.

item.description: A population of threatened golden bandicoots is booming at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary, north-west of Alice Springs.

item.description: When it comes to batch cooking, don't forget breakfast. This granola can make mornings easier and will last weeks.

item.description: Nancy Guthrie was last seen alive when a relative dropped her outside her Tucson home after a family games night. The 84-year-old grandmother has now been missing for a week.

item.title: Trump endorses Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi ahead of Japan's election
item.description: One of Sanae Takaichi's first engagements after she was elevated to prime minister in October was to host Donald Trump in Tokyo.

item.title: Family from Netherlands calls for change after 27yo dies of suspected heatstroke in remote WA
item.description: Tiffani Phelps de Wildt died after collapsing on a remote station in WA's north. Her family says, had they known the risks, they would have tried to stop her from going out in the heat.

item.description: The remarkable story of Austin Appelbee's marathon swim for help went around the world, so why did it spark such an emotional reaction?

item.description: A woman who had been in Perth to visit family was asleep when a car crashed into an inner-city home, killing her, late on Friday night.

item.description: Zubayar Al-Bakoush, 58, has been wanted by the United States for more than a decade for his alleged role in the attack, which killed four Americans, including the US ambassador to Libya.

item.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns has told demonstrators planning to protest Israel President Isaac Herzog's visit to Sydney that there should be "no clashes or violence".

item.title: The Mark of Cain lead singer on a lifetime masking the truth
item.description: The lead singer of legendary Adelaide rockers The Mark of Cain this week announced she was transgender, but it comes after nearly 60 years of hiding the truth from everyone.

item.description: As Thailand prepares to head to the polls, voters remain wary that in their version of democracy, the party they vote for is not always the one that takes power.

item.description: Australians flock to Japan each year to take advantage of its unique and plentiful snow, but it's not just the travel costs that are mounting.

item.description: Xavier Rudd performs solo these days, but he carries a spirit with him wherever he goes.

item.description: Some Chinese Australians have mixed feelings about the sudden global embrace of Chinese culture after the trend emerged late last year.

item.description: For a show that lasts roughly 13 minutes, the Super Bowl half-time performance has fuelled decades of conversation.

item.description: Australia makes a hot start to the Rugby Sevens in Perth, with both the men's and women's teams going unbeaten in securing semifinal berths.

item.description: As the West reacts to the revelations in the latest batch of Epstein files, China has plans for the renminbi to become a global reserve currency.

item.title: United States send India a T20 World Cup scare before Suryakumar Yadav settles hosts
item.description: India is briefly left reeling at 6-67 against an underdog United States team, but captain Suryakumar Yadav helps the hosts avoid a horror start at the T20 World Cup.

item.description: From grapes to red capsicum, here's how to prioritise some of this season's best fruit and veg.

item.description: The ABC can reveal the state government has paid almost $500 million to tens of thousands of victims of crime over the past three financial years.

item.description: Josh Madrid was arrested for attending a pro-democracy protest in Venezuela. 24 hours later, he fled his homeland, fearing he would be killed by the government.

item.title: New hope for national gun register 30 years after it was first proposed
item.description: First proposed after the Port Arthur massacre in 1996, Australia still doesn't have a national gun register. As Queensland parliament sits for the first time since national gun reforms became law, advocates say it is time to centralise firearm information.

item.title: Coalition reunited after last-minute deal
item.description: The Liberals and Nationals have reached a breakthrough deal to reunite the Coalition after 11th-hour talks.

item.title: Heat and fires expose ancestral remains in Victoria's north-west
item.description: Ancestral remains that could be thousands of years old have been uncovered by erosion, dust storms and bushfires in Victoria.

item.title: The slow death of Keir Starmer's prime ministership after Peter Mandelson's 'betrayal'
item.description: Starmer's decision to hand the plum job of UK ambassador in Washington to Lord Peter Mandelson, despite knowing Mandelson had maintained a friendship with Jeffrey Epstein well past Epstein's conviction for soliciting underage prostitution, may simply be too large an error of judgement for the public to accept.

item.title: Before opening Meg's Bookshop in 1991, the Arnolds were told kids 'didn't read' in Port Pirie
item.description: In one of Australia's most disadvantaged regions, more known for its lead than its literature, a couple wanted to open a book store but were told children didn't read books there. They did it anyway, and it went on to become a "world class" institution.

item.title: Valentino Guseli missed out on a bonus 2026 Winter Olympics medal, but won something even more important
item.description: It was 18 months ago that Valentino Guseli blew out his ACL attempting a backside 1800 at the Beijing big air. At the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics snowboard big air final, he put that ghost to rest.

item.description: A South Korean cryptocurrency exchange apologises after mistakenly transferring more than $60 billion worth of bitcoin to users, which briefly prompted a sell-off on the platform.

item.description: Brad Arnold, a founder and the lead singer of American rock band 3 Doors Down, dies nine months after revealing he had kidney cancer.

item.description: Police are investigating three incidents of damage on lines around Bologna, and have not ruled out a potential link to the Milan Cortina Games.

item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says the federal government's budget in May will focus on productivity, spending restraint and tax reform.

item.description: From leaf blowers to dance moves, photographers use every trick they can think of to get the perfect shot for the biggest performance-horse sale in the southern hemisphere.

item.description: The Palestine Action Group lodged submissions late on Sunday afternoon, arguing the declaration was "draconian" and imposed rules unsuitable for protest activity.

item.title: Search effort winds down for missing Gold Coast fisherman

item.description: South Sydney have pulled off one of the biggest recruitment moves in NRL history after signing Brisbane enforcer Payne Haas to a three-year contract from 2027.

item.description: Police officers armed with rifles guarded their colleagues while they recovered the man's body from the crash site in difficult terrain near Normanton, in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

item.description: Less than six weeks from the South Australian election, the Liberal Party has announced an election promise on stamp duty while the Labor government unveil its plan to create 1,300 new aged care beds.

item.description: Lindsey Vonn's shocking downhill crash at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games was always a possibility given the American was competing just nine days after rupturing her ACL. But it was never going to stop her from trying.

item.title: Greens politician Kat McNamara quits NT parliament 18 months after historic Nightcliff win
item.description: Kat McNamara is leaving the role effectively immediately due to "ongoing health challenges". It comes 18 months after she became the first Greens candidate to win a seat in NT parliament.

item.title: Backyard pods won't fix the housing crisis but they signal a shift
item.description: Australia's biggest hardware retailer has started selling tiny homes. Are backyard pods the answer to a national housing crisis?

item.title: Search ends for 'very loved' Gold Coast fisherman Ash Haigh after almost five days lost at sea
item.description: Queensland Police has suspended the cross-border search for missing Gold Coast fisherman Ash Haigh after an extensive air and sea operation found no signs of life, with his sister describing him as a "very loved" family man.

item.title: Iran sentences Nobel Peace Prize winner Narges Mohammadi to six more years in prison
item.description: Women's rights activist Narges Mohammadi is sentenced to a further six years in jail.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 3, Monday, February 9
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan today.

item.title: HESTA CEO Debby Blakey resigns after superannuation administration outage
item.description: HESTA's boss is calling it quits after 11 years in the role. Her exit follows an outage that left members unable to access their accounts.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Lindsey Vonn hailed as 'idol' by downhill rivals after Milano Cortina crash
item.description: Lindsey Vonn's 2026 Winter Olympic Games ended in disaster, but her teammates and rivals have heaped praise on the three-time Olympic medallist.

item.title: Jon Kudelka, Walkley-winning Tasmanian cartoonist, dies from brain cancer
item.description: Award-winning Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka dies after being diagnosed with brain cancer in 2024.

item.title: Christchurch terrorist gives testimony in NZ appeal court as he attempts to vacate guilty pleas over 2019 attack
item.description: The convicted Christchurch terrorist and murderer is giving testimony in the New Zealand Court of Appeal as he seeks to vacate his guilty pleas over his 2019 attack on two mosques.

item.title: Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years in landmark case
item.description: Jimmy Lai, one of Hong Kong's most outspoken critics of China, has learned his fate after being sentenced this morning.

item.title: Independent inquiry launched into NACC chief's handling of defence ties
item.description: The body responsible for holding the federal integrity watchdog to account will formally investigate it for agency maladministration and its chief, Paul Brereton, for officer misconduct.

item.title: Rain brings relief and road closures after record heatwave in South Australia
item.description: High rainfall in north-eastern South Australia brings some relief for pastoralists after record-breaking heat, with a reprieve expected for metropolitan Adelaide this week.

item.title: Five simple, tasty vegetarian recipes that are perfect for meat-free Mondays
item.description: Looking to add some more vegetarian dishes to your weekly rotation? We have you covered with these five recipes that are perfect for meat-free Mondays.

item.title: NFL Super Bowl LX quick hits: Mack Hollins dresses as a prisoner, Bad Bunny hosts a wedding and Michael Dickson's punts help Seattle Seahawks win
item.description: The most important match of the NFL season crowns a champion, but also provides eye-catching moments on and off the field. Here are five quick hits from Super Bowl LX.

item.title: Family rallies to save pets left behind in Daly River flood evacuation
item.description: When hundreds of people evacuated the Daly River community due to flooding, most had to leave their pets behind. But a nearby family swung into action to help.

item.title: Bad Bunny's Super Bowl half-time show features surprise guests Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin
item.description: Global superstar Bad Bunny performs at the Super Bowl LX, sharing the stage with surprise guests Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin, while a couple weds on stage.

item.title: SpaceX to build 'self-growing city' on Moon, Elon Musk says
item.description: Billionaire chief executive says the company will shift its focus from Mars and the project could be achieved within 10 years.

item.title: Palestine Action Group loses court challenge to extra police powers
item.description: A Supreme Court challenge was launched by Palestine Action Group on Sunday.

item.title: New gun ownership laws announced by Queensland Premier David Crisafulli
item.description: The laws aim to crack down on rising gun crime and include tougher penalties for drive-by shootings.

item.title: Inside Minnesotan homes these people are hiding from ICE and living in fear for their children and parents
item.description: What was once a hindrance is now "a paranoia like I've never known before", one Minnesotan man says, as his family hides from immigration agents.

item.title: Daly River expected to surpass major flood level before reaching peak
item.description: Flooding at the Daly River community is expected to surpass the major flood level late Monday, with a peak of 14.1 metres expected by Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: Heavy rain in central Australia causes celebration and concern
item.description: Rain across central Australia has been welcomed at cattle stations, but flooding and road damage have cut off some remote communities.

item.title: Police and protesters clash in Sydney rally against Israeli President Issac Herzog's visit to Australia
item.description: Thousands of people attend protests across the country against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit to Australia in the wake of the Bondi terror attack, with demonstrators in Sydney sprayed with pepper spray and led away in handcuffs.

item.title: Heavy police presence at Sydney Town Hall as protesters gather
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Families of Laos methanol poisoning victims say they've been left in the dark on investigations
item.description: The families of Bianca Jones and Holly Morton-Bowles say they have been left in the dark following the 2024 poisoning deaths of their daughters.

item.title: Sanae Takaichi's stomping victory will have profound consequences for Australia and the Asia-Pacific
item.description: A stomping victory by the ruling coalition government of Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi has opened the way for a major geo-strategic realignment in the Asia-Pacific region, with big implications for Australia.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Protesters gather at Flinders Street Station
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: ASIO was told about Bondi shooter's terrorist links years before attack, former spy claims
item.description: The former undercover agent spied on the Akrams when he infiltrated a Sydney IS terror cell for Australia's intelligence agency.

item.title: 'Massive' Indonesian ghost barge washes up on tiny Torres Strait island
item.description: The barge drifted into Australian waters from Indonesia after breaking from its moorings during bad weather.

item.title: Live: Aussies Coady and Stalker miss the medals in big air final
item.description: Australian's Tess Coady and Mela Stalker miss the podium in the snowboard big air final, while Holly Harris and Jason Chan become the first Aussies in 12 years to represent the country in ice dancing. Follow live.

item.title: Shaun Dunk asks to be 'locked up' 15 days before alleged stabbing murder, court hears
item.description: Fifteen days before he allegedly killed a woman and attempted to kill another, Shaun Michael Dunk asked to be taken into custody so he would not be a danger to anyone.

item.title: Police and protesters clash at Sydney's Town Hall
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: William and Kate 'deeply concerned' about Epstein files as Andrew faces fresh scrutiny
item.description: The Prince and Princess of Wales say their thoughts remain focused on the victims of the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, in their first statement on the issue.

item.title: Maritime safety regulator investigating luxury Carnival cruise ship after whistleblower concerns
item.description: The maritime union says crew members of a luxury Carnival cruise ship allege they are being made to sleep in crowded rooms, lack access to safe free drinking water, and that some are earning as little as $2.50 an hour.

item.title: Commonwealth files defence against Linda Reynolds legal action in federal court
item.description: The Commonwealth files its defence against former senator Linda Reynolds, who is suing the government and its lawyers over a $2.4 million payout it made to Brittany Higgins.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Mitchell weakens to low after crossing WA's north-west coast
item.description: The system is expected to weaken as it tracks farther south-east and moves inland through the Gascoyne region.

item.title: Scottish Labour leader calls for UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer to quit
item.description: Keir Starmer is facing calls to resign after damaging revelations about the man he picked to represent the UK in Washington.

item.title: US seizes tanker in Indian Ocean that fled Caribbean blockade
item.description: The Pentagon says the vessel was operating in breach of Donald Trump's orders on sanctioned ships in the region.

item.title: King stands ready to help police with Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor investigation, palace says
item.description: Police have confirmed they are assessing information provided to them that former prince Andrew had passed late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein confidential reports while the former royal was British trade envoy more than a decade ago.

item.title: First stage of Marinus Link approved by Australian Economic Regulator despite uncertainty about impact on bills
item.description: The economic regulator has approved the first stage of the Marinus Link electricity connection between Tasmania and Victoria, and the associated transmission line, but it's not known what effect it will have on Tasmanians' power bills.

item.title: ABC Timelines quiz: Test your memory of the 2020s … so far
item.description: Today we're testing your memory of some of the major events of the 2020s in pop culture, sport and world news. Your challenge is to pick which happened first.

item.title: Silver was shared at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics men's team combined, so what happens to the bronze medal?
item.description: In the men's team combined Alpine skiing event at the 2026 Winter Olympics, the Swiss and Austrian teams tied for silver. So what happens to the bronze medal?

item.title: Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka and the art of cutting through political spin
item.description: Hailed as an artist who "knew the power of comedy in holding truth to power", Jon Kudelka once described himself as "like a monkey with an automatic rifle".

item.title: Brisbane Broncos captain Adam Reynolds holds hope of Payne Haas contract backflip
item.description: Brisbane prop Payne Haas is set to arrive in England for the World Club Challenge where his teammates will try to convince him not to honour his deal with South Sydney.

item.title: Two people seriously injured in stabbing and hit and run near Swan Hill
item.description: Victoria Police says a man turned himself in after allegedly running over a man and stabbing a woman near Swan Hill on Monday night.

item.title: More people say they'll vote One Nation. What are they voting for?
item.description: One Nation questions if man-made climate change is real, wants to wind back access to abortion care, and plans to pay the HECS debts of doctors working in the regions.

item.title: Roblox on notice after 'disturbing' reports of child grooming
item.description: The government puts popular social gaming site Roblox on notice following media reports of children being approached and groomed by predators on the platform.

item.title: Painkillers and HRT therapies among drugs not being subsidised under PBS
item.description: Painkillers, HRT therapies and incontinence medicines are among the drugs that will not benefit from the new maximum $25 script price.

item.title: St Kilda star Max King injured again, Port ruckman Ivan Soldo out for season
item.description: Max King has suffered another injury, further frustrating the St Kilda key forward's bid for an AFL return.

item.title: Shield and First Guardian collapses spur managed investment scheme crackdown
item.description: The federal government plans a crackdown on managed investment schemes following the collapses of Shield Master Fund and First Guardian.

item.title: How AI is disrupting the tech boom on global markets
item.description: Amongst tech investors the penny has finally dropped about just what the future may hold, and many are backing off or at least rethinking their strategy.

item.title: Cheryl Grimmer's family fights for new charges against suspect
item.description: NSW Parliament will again debate the 1970 disappearance of toddler Cheryl Grimmer, following claims her family's pleas for fresh charges against a suspect who confessed to murdering her when he was a teenager have been ignored.

item.title: Pakistan reverses cricket T20 World Cup boycott and will face India in Sri Lanka
item.description: Pakistan has ‍agreed to play India ​in the ⁠T20 World Cup match scheduled to take ‌place in Colombo this ‍Sunday, February 15.

item.title: Former ATSIC head Geoff Clark was jailed but his community says legal issues persist
item.description: Former ATSIC leader Geoff Clark was jailed in 2024, yet some members of his community say legal issues linger on.

item.title: Man jailed for raping teenager under care of Department for Child Protection
item.description: A 33-year-old man has been jailed for more than eight years for raping a teenage girl who was in the care of South Australia's Department for Child Protection.

item.title: Body corporates urged to be cautious after alleged $2m strata account fraud
item.description: The loss of $2 million from strata property accounts on the NSW Mid North Coast triggers concerns about the protection of shared assets.

item.title: First national plan to address violence against Indigenous women and children
item.description: A national plan to tackle domestic violence against First Nations women was "hard fought for by Aboriginal women", an advocate says.

item.title: Native title holders take appeal over one of Australia's largest groundwater licences to High Court
item.description: The cultural value of water will be front and centre in the High Court in Canberra today as a group of native title holders from Central Australia fight to assert cultural rights over an aquifer under their lands.

item.title: Angus Taylor faces pressure to challenge for Liberal leadership
item.description: Liberal leadership aspirant Angus Taylor is facing pressure from conservative supporters to challenge Sussan Ley this week and end the damaging speculation paralysing the party.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell will only talk if Donald Trump grants clemency, lawyer says
item.description: The jailed accomplice of sex predator Jeffrey Epstein refuses to answer questions for the US Congress — but her lawyer says she will cooperate if granted clemency by the president.

item.title: Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi sizzle, but Wuthering Heights isn't quite the full Brontë
item.description: The two Queensland "bogans" put on a show, but Emerald Fennell's Wuthering Heights is more wish fulfilment than a meaningful adaptation of the classic novel.

item.title: States urged to sign National Water Agreement even though users unaware what's in final version
item.description: As the country's state governments and territories consider signing a new national water policy that seeks to address climate change and elevate First Nations knowledge, the agriculture industry fears it has been overlooked.

item.title: Live: Government calls for respect after clashes at Sydney anti-Herzog protest
item.description: The federal government urges people protesting against the visit of Israel's president to show respect in the wake of clashes between police and demonstrators at a Sydney rally on Monday evening. Follow live.

item.title: Man drowns while swimming off New Norfolk pontoon in River Derwent, near Hobart
item.description: A man has drowned while swimming with friends off a pontoon in the Derwent River near Hobart, police confirm.

item.title: A nod to her Olympic legacy as former premier Annastacia Palaszczuk's portrait unveiled in parliament
item.description: Former Queensland premier Annastacia Palaszczuk's parliamentary portrait contains a small nod to her Olympic legacy.

item.title: Swifts Creek faces tough task of reinventing itself amid job losses
item.description: Job losses mean Swifts Creek in Victoria's High Country is facing an identity crisis, but it is not the only small town undergoing a transformation.

item.title: NSW Police defends actions of officers in violent Sydney protest against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit
item.description: Twenty-seven people were arrested, including 10 for assaulting police, on Monday night at a demonstration against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit to Australia.

item.title: Live: ASX set for more after booming day sees market rocket nearly 2pc
item.description: The ASX 200 rocketed nearly 2 per cent higher yesterday, with the futures market tipping it to expand further in trading. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.
